<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Securities registered pursuant to Section&#160;12(g) of the Act: None</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Indicate by check mark whether the registrant (1)&#160;has filed all reports required to be filed by Section&#160;13 or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 during the preceding 12 months (or for such shorter period that the registrant was required to file such reports), and (2)&#160;has been subject to such filing requirements for the past 90 days. <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000015" name="dei:EntityCurrentReportingStatus" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130">Yes</ix:nonNumeric>&#160;<span style="font-family:Segoe UI Symbol;">&#9746;</span>&#160;&#160;&#160;No&#160;<span style="font-family:Segoe UI Symbol;">&#9744;</span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Indicate by check mark whether the registrant has submitted electronically every Interactive Data File required to be submitted pursuant to Rule 405 of Regulation S-T (&#167;232.405 of this chapter) during the preceding 12 months (or for such shorter period that the registrant was required to submit such files). <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000030" name="dei:EntityInteractiveDataCurrent" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130">Yes</ix:nonNumeric>&#160;<span style="font-family:Segoe UI Symbol;">&#9746;</span>&#160;&#160;&#160;No&#160;<span style="font-family:Segoe UI Symbol;">&#9744;</span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Indicate by check mark whether the registrant is a large accelerated filer, an accelerated filer, a non-accelerated filer, a <span style="color:#000000;">smaller reporting company</span>, or an emerging growth company. See the definitions of &#8220;large accelerated filer,&#8221; &#8220;accelerated filer,&#8221; &#8220;smaller reporting company,&#8221; and &#8220;emerging growth company&#8221; in Rule 12b-2 of the Exchange Act.</p>

Yes&#160;<span style="font-family:Segoe UI Symbol;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000012" name="dei:EntityShellCompany" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" format="ixt-sec:boolballotbox">&#9744;</ix:nonNumeric></span>&#160;&#160;&#160;No&#160;<span style="font-family:Segoe UI Symbol;">&#9746;</span></p>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#TABLE_CONTENTS"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:1pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;" id="FORWARDLOOKING_STATEMENTS">FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Statements and information included in this Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q by Schnitzer Steel Industries, Inc. that are not purely historical are forward-looking statements within the meaning of Section&#160;21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and are made pursuant to the &#8220;safe harbor&#8221; provisions of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Except as noted herein or as the context may otherwise require, all references to &#8220;we,&#8221; &#8220;our,&#8221; &#8220;us,&#8221; &#8220;the Company&#8221; and &#8220;SSI&#8221; refer to Schnitzer Steel Industries, Inc. and its consolidated subsidiaries.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Forward-looking statements in this Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q include statements regarding future events or our expectations, intentions, beliefs and strategies regarding the future, which may include statements regarding trends, cyclicality and changes in the markets we sell into&#59; the Company&#8217;s outlook, growth initiatives or expected results or objectives, including pricing, margins, sales volumes and profitability&#59; strategic direction or goals&#59; targets&#59; changes to manufacturing and production processes&#59; the cost of and the status of any agreements or actions related to our compliance with environmental and other laws&#59; expected tax rates, deductions and credits&#59; the impact of sanctions and tariffs, quotas and other trade actions and import restrictions&#59; the realization of deferred tax assets&#59; planned capital expenditures&#59; liquidity positions&#59; our ability to generate cash from continuing operations&#59; the potential impact of adopting new accounting pronouncements&#59; obligations under our retirement plans&#59; benefits, savings or additional costs from business realignment, cost containment and productivity improvement programs&#59; and the adequacy of accruals.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Forward-looking statements by their nature address matters that are, to different degrees, uncertain, and often contain words such as &#8220;outlook,&#8221; &#8220;target,&#8221; &#8220;aim,&#8221; &#8220;believes,&#8221; &#8220;expects,&#8221; &#8220;anticipates,&#8221; &#8220;intends,&#8221; &#8220;assumes,&#8221; &#8220;estimates,&#8221; &#8220;evaluates,&#8221; &#8220;may,&#8221; &#8220;will,&#8221; &#8220;should,&#8221; &#8220;could,&#8221; &#8220;opinions,&#8221; &#8220;forecasts,&#8221; &#8220;projects,&#8221; &#8220;plans,&#8221; &#8220;future,&#8221; &#8220;forward,&#8221; &#8220;potential,&#8221; &#8220;probable,&#8221; and similar expressions. However, the absence of these words or similar expressions does not mean that a statement is not forward-looking.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">We may make other forward-looking statements from time to time, including in reports filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, press releases, presentations and on public conference calls. All forward-looking statements we make are based on information available to us at the time the statements are made, and we assume no obligation to update any forward-looking statements, except as may be required by law. Our business is subject to the effects of changes in domestic and global economic conditions and a number of other risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially from those included in, or implied by, such forward-looking statements. Some of these risks and uncertainties are discussed in &#8220;Item 1A. Risk Factors&#8221; of Part I of our most recent Annual Report on Form 10-K, as supplemented by our subsequently filed Quarterly Reports on Form 10-Q. Examples of these risks include: potential environmental cleanup costs related to the Portland Harbor Superfund site or other locations&#59; the cyclicality and impact of general economic conditions&#59; changing conditions in global markets including the impact of sanctions and tariffs, quotas and other trade actions and import restrictions&#59; volatile supply and demand conditions affecting prices and volumes in the markets for both our products and raw materials we purchase&#59; imbalances in supply and demand conditions in the global steel industry&#59; the impact of goodwill impairment charges&#59; the impact of long-lived asset and equity investment impairment charges&#59; inability to achieve or sustain the benefits from productivity, cost savings and restructuring initiatives&#59; inability to realize or delays in realizing expected benefits from investments in technology&#59; inability to renew facility leases&#59; difficulties associated with acquisitions and integration of acquired businesses&#59; customer fulfillment of their contractual obligations&#59; increases in the relative value of the U.S. dollar&#59; the impact of foreign currency fluctuations&#59; potential limitations on our ability to access capital resources and existing credit facilities&#59; restrictions on our business and financial covenants under our bank credit agreement&#59; the impact of consolidation in the steel industry&#59; freight rates and the availability of transportation&#59; the impact of equipment upgrades, equipment failures and facility damage on production&#59; product liability claims&#59; the impact of legal proceedings and legal compliance&#59; the adverse impact of climate change&#59; the impact of not realizing deferred tax assets&#59; the impact of tax increases and changes in tax rules&#59; the impact of one or more cybersecurity incidents&#59; environmental compliance costs and potential environmental liabilities&#59; inability to obtain or renew business licenses and permits&#59; compliance with climate change and greenhouse gas emission laws and regulations&#59; reliance on employees subject to collective bargaining agreements&#59; and the impact of the underfunded status of multiemployer plans in which we participate.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">3</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#TABLE_CONTENTS"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:8pt;">&#160;</p>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:5pt;">&#160;</p>

<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1.62%;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1%;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:12.88%;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1%;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:66.98%;">

<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1.62%;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1%;white-space:nowrap;">

<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:12.88%;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000372" name="us-gaap:CapitalExpendituresIncurredButNotYetPaid" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">8,106</ix:nonFraction></p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1%;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000373" name="us-gaap:CapitalExpendituresIncurredButNotYetPaid" contextRef="C_0000912603_20180901_20181130" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">7,418</ix:nonFraction></p></td>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:1pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

</table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The accompanying Notes to the Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements are an integral part of these statements.</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">9</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#TABLE_CONTENTS"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">SCHNITZER STEEL INDUSTRIES, INC.</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000374" name="us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000374_dcnt_34104d95-14b3-4eef-97d4-ae2834e13ec1">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note 1 - Summary of Significant Accounting Policies</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000387" name="us-gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;" id="FS_NOTES">Basis of Presentation</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The accompanying Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements of Schnitzer Steel Industries, Inc. and its majority-owned and wholly-owned subsidiaries (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) have been prepared pursuant to generally accepted accounting principles in the United States of America (&#8220;U.S. GAAP&#8221;) for interim financial information and the rules and regulations of the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (the &#8220;SEC&#8221;) for Form 10-Q, including Article 10 of Regulation S-X. The year-end condensed consolidated balance sheet data was derived from audited financial statements, but does not include all disclosures required by U.S. GAAP. Certain information and note disclosures normally included in annual financial statements have been condensed or omitted pursuant to the rules and regulations of the SEC. In the opinion of management, all normal, recurring adjustments considered necessary for a fair statement have been included. Management suggests that these Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements be read in conjunction with the financial statements and notes thereto included in the Company&#8217;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended August&#160;31, 2019. The results for the three months ended November 30, 2019 and 2018 are not necessarily indicative of the results of operations for the entire fiscal year.</p></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000388" name="us-gaap:SegmentReportingPolicyPolicyTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Segments</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company&#8217;s internal organizational and reporting structure includes <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_schnsegment" id="F_000409" name="us-gaap:NumberOfOperatingSegments" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" decimals="INF" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_schnsegment" id="F_000410" name="us-gaap:NumberOfReportableSegments" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" decimals="INF" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">two</ix:nonFraction></ix:nonFraction> operating and reportable segments: the Auto and Metals Recycling (&#8220;AMR&#8221;) business and the Cascade Steel and Scrap (&#8220;CSS&#8221;) business.</p></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000389" name="schn:AccountingChangesPolicyTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Accounting Changes</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">As of the beginning of the first quarter of fiscal 2020, the Company adopted an accounting standards update, initially issued in February 2016, that requires a lessee to recognize a lease liability and a lease right-of-use asset on its balance sheet for all leases greater than 12 months, including those classified as operating leases. The update supersedes the previous lease accounting standard. The Company adopted the new lease accounting standard using the modified retrospective transition method, whereby it applied the new requirements by recognizing a cumulative-effect adjustment to the opening balance of retained earnings as of September 1, 2019. <span style="color:#000000;">Such cumulative-effect adjustment for the Company was not material.</span> Adoption using the modified retrospective transition method did not have an impact on any prior period earnings of the Company, and no comparative prior periods were adjusted for the new guidance. The Company elected a package of practical expedients permitted under the transition guidance within the new lease accounting standard, which among other things, permit carrying forward the historical lease classification. The Company also elected the practical expedient exempting short-term leases from balance sheet recognition, whereby payments for such leases are recognized in the income statement on a straight-line basis over the lease term. In addition, the Company elected the practical expedient to not separate lease and non-lease components, which the Company elected to apply to all classes of underlying assets. Adoption of the new standard resulted in recogniti<span style="color:#000000;">on of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000411" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseRightOfUseAsset" contextRef="C_0000912603_us-gaapAdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis_us-gaapAccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member_20190901" decimals="-6" scale="6">126</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000412" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseLiability" contextRef="C_0000912603_us-gaapAdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis_us-gaapAccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member_20190901" decimals="-6" scale="6">128</ix:nonFraction> million of operating </span>lease right-of-use assets and liabilities, respectively, as of September 1, 2019, <span style="color:#000000;">which are presented as separate line items on the balance sheet</span>. Operating lease right-of-use assets are considered long-lived assets subject to existing long-lived asset impairment guidance. <span style="color:#000000;">Adoption also resulted in the reclassification of the Company&#8217;s capital lease assets and obligations as finance lease right-of-use assets and liabilities as of September 1, 2019, with such reclassification having no impact on the carrying amounts or financial statement line items within which the leases are reported.</span> See Note 3 - Leases for the disclosures required under the new standard.</p></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000390" name="us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Cash and Cash Equivalents</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Cash and cash equivalents include short-term securities that are not restricted by third parties and have an original maturity date of 90 days or less. Included in accounts payable are book overdrafts representing outstanding checks in excess of funds on deposit o<span style="color:#000000;">f $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000413" name="us-gaap:BankOverdrafts" contextRef="C_0000912603_20191130" decimals="-6" scale="6">14</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000414" name="us-gaap:BankOverdrafts" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190831" decimals="-6" scale="6">27</ix:nonFraction></span> million as of November 30, 2019 and August&#160;31, 2019, respectively.</p></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000391" name="us-gaap:ReceivablesTradeAndOtherAccountsReceivableAllowanceForDoubtfulAccountsPolicy" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000391_dcnt_1bd85cda-affd-41a5-a608-a28f56ce8c93">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Accounts Receivable, net</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Accounts receivable represent amounts primarily due from customers on product and other sales. These accounts receivable, which are reduced by an allowance for doubtful accounts, are recorded at the invoiced amount and do not bear interest. The Company extends credit to customers under contracts containing customary and explicit payment terms, and payment is generally required within 30 to 60 days of shipment. Nonferrous export sales typically require a deposit prior to shipment. Historically, almost all of the Company&#8217;s ferrous export sales have been made with letters of credit. Domestic ferrous metal sales, nonferrous metal sales and finished steel sales are generally made on open account, and the majority of these sales are covered by credit insurance.</p></ix:nonNumeric></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">10</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#TABLE_CONTENTS"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">SCHNITZER STEEL INDUSTRIES, INC.</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000374_dcnt_34104d95-14b3-4eef-97d4-ae2834e13ec1"><ix:continuation id="F_000391_dcnt_1bd85cda-affd-41a5-a608-a28f56ce8c93">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company evaluates the collectibility of its accounts receivable based on a combination of factors, including whether sales were made pursuant to letters of credit or credit insurance is in place. In cases where management is aware of circumstances that may impair a customer&#8217;s ability to meet its financial obligations, management records a specific allowance against amounts due and reduces the receivable to the amount the Company believes will be collected. For all other customers, the Company maintains an allowance that considers the total receivables outstanding, historical collection rates and economic trends. Accounts are written off when all efforts to collect have been exhausted.</span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Also included in accounts receivable are short-term advances to scrap metal suppliers used as a mechanism to acquire unprocessed scrap metal. The advances are generally repaid with scrap metal, as opposed to cash. Repayments of advances with scrap metal are treated as noncash operating activities in the Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows and <span style="color:#000000;">totaled&#160;$<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000415" name="us-gaap:NoncashOrPartNoncashAcquisitionInventoryAcquired1" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" decimals="-6" scale="6">2</ix:nonFraction> million</span> and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000416" name="us-gaap:NoncashOrPartNoncashAcquisitionInventoryAcquired1" contextRef="C_0000912603_20180901_20181130" decimals="-6" scale="6">4</ix:nonFraction> million for the three months ended November 30, 2019 and 2018, respectively.</p></ix:continuation><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000392" name="schn:OtherAssetsPolicyTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Prepaid Expenses</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company&#8217;s prepaid expenses, reported within prepaid expenses and other current assets in the Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheets, <span style="color:#000000;">totaled&#160;$<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000417" name="us-gaap:PrepaidExpenseCurrent" contextRef="C_0000912603_us-gaapBalanceSheetLocationAxis_us-gaapPrepaidExpensesAndOtherCurrentAssetsMember_20191130" decimals="-6" scale="6">22</ix:nonFraction> million&#160;and</span>&#160;$<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000418" name="us-gaap:PrepaidExpenseCurrent" contextRef="C_0000912603_us-gaapBalanceSheetLocationAxis_us-gaapPrepaidExpensesAndOtherCurrentAssetsMember_20190831" decimals="-6" scale="6">23</ix:nonFraction> million&#160;as of November 30, 2019 and August&#160;31, 2019, respectively, and consisted primarily of deposits on capital projects, prepaid services, prepaid property taxes and prepaid insurance.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Other Assets</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company&#8217;s other assets, exclusive of prepaid expenses, consist primarily of receivables from insurers, spare parts, an equity investment, debt issuance costs, and notes and other contractual receivables. Other assets are reported within either prepaid expenses and other current assets or other assets in the Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheets based on their expected use either during or beyond the current operating cycle of one year from the reporting date. Receivables from insurers totaled<span style="color:#000000;">&#160;$<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000419" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyReceivable" contextRef="C_0000912603_20191130" decimals="-6" scale="6">7</ix:nonFraction> million&#160;and&#160;</span>$<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000420" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyReceivable" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190831" decimals="-6" scale="6">89</ix:nonFraction> million&#160;as of November 30, 2019 and August&#160;31, 2019, respectively, with <span style="color:#000000;">the decrease </span>in the first quarter of fiscal 2020 resulting primarily from full payment by the Company&#8217;s insurers of settlements for lawsuits arising from a 2016 motor vehicle collision. See &#8220;Contingencies &#8211; Other&#8221; in Note 5 &#8211; Commitments and Contingencies for further discussion of this matter.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company invested $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000421" name="us-gaap:CostMethodInvestmentsOriginalCost" contextRef="C_0000912603_20170831" decimals="-6" scale="6">6</ix:nonFraction> million in the equity of a privately-held waste and recycling entity in fiscal 2017. The equity investment does not have a readily determinable fair value and, therefore, is carried at cost and adjusted for impairments and observable price changes. The investment is presented as part of the AMR reportable segment and reported within other assets in the Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheets. The carrying value of the investment was <span style="color:#000000;">$<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000422" name="us-gaap:EquitySecuritiesWithoutReadilyDeterminableFairValueAmount" contextRef="C_0000912603_us-gaapBalanceSheetLocationAxis_us-gaapOtherNoncurrentAssetsMember_us-gaapStatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_schnAutoAndMetalsRecyclingMember_20191130" decimals="-6" scale="6"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000423" name="us-gaap:EquitySecuritiesWithoutReadilyDeterminableFairValueAmount" contextRef="C_0000912603_us-gaapBalanceSheetLocationAxis_us-gaapOtherNoncurrentAssetsMember_us-gaapStatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_schnAutoAndMetalsRecyclingMember_20190831" decimals="-6" scale="6">6</ix:nonFraction></ix:nonFraction> million</span> as of November 30, 2019 and August&#160;31, 2019. The Company has not recorded any impairments or upward or downward adjustments to the carrying value of the investment since acquisition.</p></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000393" name="us-gaap:ConcentrationRiskCreditRisk" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Concentration of Credit Risk</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Financial instruments that potentially subject the Company to significant concentration of credit risk consist primarily of cash and cash equivalents, accounts receivable, and notes and other contractual receivables. The majority of cash and cash equivalents is maintained with major financial institutions. Balances with these and certain other institutions exceeded the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation insured amount o<span style="color:#000000;">f $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000424" name="us-gaap:CashFDICInsuredAmount" contextRef="C_0000912603_20191130" decimals="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">250,000</ix:nonFraction></span> as of November 30, 2019. Concentration of credit risk with respect to accounts receivable is limited because a large number of geographically diverse customers make up the Company&#8217;s customer base. The Company controls credit risk through credit approvals, credit limits, insurance, letters of credit or other collateral, cash deposits and monitoring procedures. The Company is exposed to a residual credit risk with respect to open letters of credit by virtue of the possibility of the failure of a bank providing a letter of credit. The Company <span style="color:#000000;">had $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000425" name="schn:CustomerIssuedLettersOfCredit" contextRef="C_0000912603_20191130" decimals="-6" scale="6">46</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000426" name="schn:CustomerIssuedLettersOfCredit" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190831" decimals="-6" scale="6">49</ix:nonFraction></span> million of open letters of credit as of November 30, 2019 and August&#160;31, 2019, respectively.</p></ix:nonNumeric></ix:continuation><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000375" name="us-gaap:InventoryDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000375_dcnt_7d6d75b0-43ec-4bc6-aa20-86eee882ad7b">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note 2 - Inventories</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000394" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfInventoryCurrentTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" escape="true">

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">11</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#TABLE_CONTENTS"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">SCHNITZER STEEL INDUSTRIES, INC.</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000375_dcnt_7d6d75b0-43ec-4bc6-aa20-86eee882ad7b"></ix:continuation><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000376" name="schn:LesseeFinanceLeasesAndOperatingLeasesDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000376_dcnt_59f60438-68b0-4ee1-96c1-659511795e0b">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note 3 - Leases</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company enters into leases to obtain access to real property, machinery and equipment assets. Most of the Company&#8217;s lease obligations relate to real property leases for AMR operating sites, including the substantial majority of its auto parts stores, and for the Company&#8217;s administrative offices. The Company determines whether an arrangement contains a lease at inception by assessing whether it receives the right to direct the use of and obtain substantially all of the economic benefit from use of the underlying asset. Lease classification, measurement, and recognition are determined at lease commencement, which is the date the underlying asset is available for use by the Company. The accounting classification of a lease is based on whether the arrangement is effectively a financed purchase of the underlying asset (finance lease) or not (operating lease). Leases that, at lease commencement, have a non-cancellable lease term of <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000437" name="schn:ShortTermElectionNonCancellableLeaseTerm" contextRef="C_0000912603_srtRangeAxis_srtMaximumMember_20190901_20191130" format="ixt-sec:durmonth">12</ix:nonNumeric> months or less and do not include an option to either purchase the underlying asset or renew the lease beyond <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000438" name="schn:ShortTermElectionLeaseTermRenewalOption" contextRef="C_0000912603_srtRangeAxis_srtMaximumMember_20190901_20191130" format="ixt-sec:durmonth">12</ix:nonNumeric> months that the Company is reasonably certain to exercise are classified as short-term leases and are not recognized on the balance sheet.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">For leases other than short-term leases, the Company recognizes right-of-use assets and lease liabilities based primarily on the present value of future minimum lease payments over the lease term at lease commencement. Right-of-use assets represent the Company&#8217;s right to use the underlying asset during the lease term, while lease liabilities represent the Company&#8217;s obligation to make future lease payments. The lease term is the non-cancellable period of the lease, together with periods covered by renewal (or termination) options which the Company is reasonably certain to exercise (or not to exercise). Lease payments are discounted to present value using the Company&#8217;s incremental borrowing rate, unless the discount rate implicit in the lease is readily determinable. The Company&#8217;s incremental borrowing rate for each lease is the estimated rate of interest that the Company would have to pay to borrow the aggregate lease payments on a collateralized basis over the lease term. Estimation of the incremental borrowing rate requires judgment by management and reflects an assessment of the Company&#8217;s credit standing to derive an implied secured credit rating and corresponding yield curve. The Company used the incremental borrowing rate to recognize all operating lease right-of-use assets and liabilities as of the new lease accounting standard application date. Right-of-use assets and lease liabilities are subject to remeasurement after lease commencement when certain events or changes in circumstances arise, such as a change in the lease term due to reassessment of whether the Company is reasonably certain to exercise a renewal or termination option.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">For operating leases, lease expense is recognized on a straight-line basis over the lease term. For finance leases, the lease right-of-use asset is amortized on a straight-line basis and interest expense is recognized on the lease liability using the effective interest rate method. Many of the Company&#8217;s real property leases contain variable lease payments that depend on an index or a rate, which are included in the measurement of the right-of-use asset and lease liability using the index or rate at lease commencement, or with respect to the Company&#8217;s transition to the new lease accounting standard the index or rate at the application date. Subsequent changes in variable lease payments are recorded as variable lease expenses during the period in which they are incurred. The Company elected a practical expedient to not separate lease and related non-lease components for accounting purposes and, thus, costs related to such non-lease components are disclosed as lease expense. Payments for short-term leases are recognized in the income statement on a straight-line basis over the lease term.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="Background-color:#FFFFFF;">The Company&#8217;s operating leases for real property underlying its auto parts stores, metals recycling facilities, and administrative offices generally have non-cancellable lease terms of <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000439" name="us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeaseTermOfContract" contextRef="C_0000912603_srtRangeAxis_srtMinimumMember_20191130" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen" continuedAt="C_d21f27e5-7379-4c79-a7d9-300055954403">5</ix:nonNumeric> to <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000440" name="us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeaseTermOfContract" contextRef="C_0000912603_srtRangeAxis_srtMaximumMember_20191130" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">10<ix:continuation id="C_d21f27e5-7379-4c79-a7d9-300055954403"> years</ix:continuation></ix:nonNumeric> and the significant majority, but not all, contain multiple renewal options for a further <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000441" name="schn:LesseeOperatingAndFinanceLeaseTermOfContract" contextRef="C_0000912603_srtRangeAxis_srtMinimumMember_20190901_20191130" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen" continuedAt="C_105816a8-52a1-442e-92a2-7c25e17b10c2">5</ix:nonNumeric> to <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000442" name="schn:LesseeOperatingAndFinanceLeaseTermOfContract" contextRef="C_0000912603_srtRangeAxis_srtMaximumMember_20190901_20191130" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">20<ix:continuation id="C_105816a8-52a1-442e-92a2-7c25e17b10c2"> years</ix:continuation></ix:nonNumeric>. R</span>enewal options which the Company is reasonably certain to exercise are included in the measurement of lease term. <span style="Background-color:#FFFFFF;">The Company&#8217;s finance leases and other operating leases involve primarily transportation equipment assets, have non-cancellable lease terms of less than <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000443" name="schn:LesseeOperatingAndFinanceLeaseRenewalTerm" contextRef="C_0000912603_srtRangeAxis_srtMaximumMember_us-gaapPropertyPlantAndEquipmentByTypeAxis_us-gaapMachineryAndEquipmentMember_20190901_20191130" format="ixt-sec:duryear">10</ix:nonNumeric> years and usually do not include renewal options.</span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="Background-color:#FFFFFF;">For the three months ended November 30, 2019, the Company&#8217;s total lease cost was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000444" name="us-gaap:LeaseCost" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" decimals="-6" scale="6">7</ix:nonFraction> million, consisting primarily of operating lease expense of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000445" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseCost" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" decimals="-6" scale="6">6</ix:nonFraction> million and short-term lease expense of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000446" name="us-gaap:ShortTermLeaseCost" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" decimals="-6" scale="6">1</ix:nonFraction> million. The other components of the Company&#8217;s total lease cost for the period, including finance lease amortization and interest expense, variable lease expense and sublease income, were not material both individually and in aggregate. The substantial majority of the Company&#8217;s total lease cost for the three months ended November 30, 2019 is presented within cost of goods sold in the Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Statements of Operations.</span></p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">12</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#TABLE_CONTENTS"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">SCHNITZER STEEL INDUSTRIES, INC.</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000376_dcnt_59f60438-68b0-4ee1-96c1-659511795e0b" continuedAt="F_000376_dcnt_697e4ed9-d114-4e39-97d5-f6d11bce9701"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000395" name="schn:ScheduleOfFinanceLeaseRelatedAssetsAndLiabilitiesTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" escape="true">

<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</p></ix:continuation><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000377" name="us-gaap:GoodwillDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note 4 - Goodwill</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company evaluates goodwill for impairment annually on July 1 and upon the occurrence of certain triggering events or substantive changes in circumstances that indicate that the fair value of goodwill may be impaired. There <span style="color:#000000;">were no triggering events identified during the first three months of fiscal 2020 requiring an interim goodwill impairment </span>test. As of November 30, 2019 and August&#160;31, 2019, all but <span style="color:#000000;">$<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000502" name="us-gaap:Goodwill" contextRef="C_0000912603_us-gaapReportingUnitAxis_schnSingleReportingUnitMember_us-gaapStatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_schnAutoAndMetalsRecyclingMember_20191130" decimals="-6" scale="6"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000503" name="us-gaap:Goodwill" contextRef="C_0000912603_us-gaapReportingUnitAxis_schnSingleReportingUnitMember_us-gaapStatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_schnAutoAndMetalsRecyclingMember_20190831" decimals="-6" scale="6">1</ix:nonFraction></ix:nonFraction></span> million of the Company&#8217;s goodwill was carried by a <span style="-sec-ix-hidden:F_000504_2"><span style="-sec-ix-hidden:F_000505_2">single</span></span> reporting unit within AMR.</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000401" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfGoodwillTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:10pt;margin-top:10pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The gross change in the carrying amount of goodwill for the three months ended November 30, 2019 was as follows (in thousands):</p>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#TABLE_CONTENTS"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>

<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">SCHNITZER STEEL INDUSTRIES, INC.</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000378" name="us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000378_dcnt_99b247c6-b2f7-4f8d-8bb6-1f35bcc61815">
<p style="margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note 5 - Commitments and Contingencies</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Contingencies - Environmental</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company evaluates the adequacy of its environmental liabilities on a quarterly basis. Adjustments to the liabilities are made when additional information becomes available that affects the estimated costs to study or remediate any environmental issues or expenditures are made for which liabilities were established.</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000402" name="schn:ScheduleOfReservesForEnvironmentalLiabilitiesTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000912603_20190901_20191130" escape="true">
